intro: Tateishia retusa, commonly known as the slender tateishia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on the upper parts of the stems. Tateishia retusa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
